aspace_helpers.title: we need to inherit restrictions down in the ACLU report

comments.body:
Adding logic in the form of an Excel formula to allow for timely tweaking (including by stakeholders):

Run in column K, starting row 4 with rows 2, 3 - J2,3:

IF(OR(G4=0, NOT(ISBLANK(J4))),J4,IF(AND(J4="",G4>0,G4=G3+1),K3,INDEX(K$2:K3,MATCH(2,1/(G$2:G3=G4-1)))))

Starting at row 4:

If level (G4) is 0 (i.e., collection) or restriction note (J4) is present, grab what's in the original restriction note field (J4).
Else, if restriction note is blank and it is component-level (G4 is greater than 0) and it is a child of preceding (G4 is one greater than preceding), grab preceding computed restriction note,
else find parent (first value in all of preceding G that is one less than G4)and grab its computed restriction note (K).

The logic will need to be different from #186.

If level is 0 (i.e. collection-level) or the note is populated, return false (i.e. not a concern)
If level is greater than 0 and note is blank, then:
    check note of the parent (from column J), and if that is also blank, then return true (i.e. a concern)
    else return false
else return false

IF(OR(G4=0, NOT(ISBLANK(J4))), FALSE, IF(AND(G4>0, ISBLANK(J4)), IF(ISBLANK(INDEX(J$2:J3,MATCH(2,1/(G$2:G3=G4-1)))), TRUE, FALSE), FALSE))

Logic update: Check all the file-level (except 1 and 2) without a note for any children that don't have a note--the important thing is that the lowest-level components all have a note

Run on row 3, where row 2 is collection-level (0), G is the level and J is the note

```
=IF(AND(
#node is file level
G3>=3, 
#and has no restriction note
ISBLANK(J3), 
#and is leaf, i.e. following is either the same or a higher level (=smaller number)
OR(G4=G3, G4<G3)), 
#then, if true
#check if note of first parent is blank
IF(ISBLANK(LOOKUP(2,1/($G$2:G2=(G3-1)), $J$2:J3)), 
#then, if true, return true (i.e. this is of concern)
TRUE, 
#else return false (i.e. not of concern)
FALSE), 
#else return false
FALSE)
```

pdc_discovery.title: Error Indexing cron: [pdc_discovery/staging] Net::ReadTimeout: Net::ReadTimeout with #<Socket:(closed)>

comments.body: The related HoneyBadger notice for production: https://app.honeybadger.io/projects/95072/faults/99595191

The culprit was that our Solr cluster in staging became unstable. 

The problem logged by our app was that it could not create a new Solr collection and in looking closer I noticed that we could not perform this activity from the Solr Web UI either. I restarted the Solr nodes via `sudo service solr restart` in staging (`lib-solr-staging4-5-6`) and the problem went away. Restarting the service in `lib-solr-staging6` took an abnormal amount of time (like 10 minutes) but eventually it restarted and was OK.

I reindexed in staging via `bundle exec rake index:research_data` and the reindex completed as normal.
Ran reindex in production to make sure that cluster was OK and reindex completed successfully.

comments.body:
CI is broken because the `figgy` role depends on the `postgres` role - see https://github.com/pulibrary/princeton_ansible/blob/main/roles/figgy/meta/main.yml#L27.

Is figgy the only reason we need the new "create a read-only user" playbook? If this is a pattern we want to move away from, we could incorporate those tasks into the figgy role as `roles/figgy/tasks/readonly_pg_user.yml` instead of having a playbook for them.
